alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 9:27PM CDT until June 28 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
